**Serpent's Tongue** is an artifact [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") and [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack")

It does double damage to *all* monsters, and even more to non-poison-resistant enemies:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

- 40% chance of 2 + d6 damage
- 30% chance of 4 + 2d6 damage
- 20% chance of 6 + 3d6 damage
- 10% chance of poison [instadeath](/wiki/Instadeath "Instadeath")

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Comparison with other artifacts](#Comparison_with_other_artifacts)
- [3 Miscellaneous](#Miscellaneous)
- [4 Encyclopedia](#Encyclopedia)
- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

In SLASH'EM (but not SpliceHack), Serpent's Tongue is the first sacrifice gift for [necromancers](/wiki/Necromancer "Necromancer"). In both variants, it can also be generated randomly, and the mechanics of artifact generation make it very common: it is the only artifact (plain) dagger, meaning every randomly generated dagger has a 5% chance of becoming Serpent's Tongue. As daggers are very common items, it is thus generated quite frequently.

## Comparison with other artifacts

Despite its being a weak base item type and comparing unfavorably with many other artifacts at +0, a fully-enchanted Serpent's Tongue is among the best weapons in SLASH'EM from an average expected damage perspective. A +7 Serpent's Tongue will, in the best case scenario, do an average of:

- 5 base damage vs. small and 4 base damage vs. large foes
- plus 2 x 7 = 14 from the doubled enchantment
- plus 90% chance of an additional \~10 average damage and 10% chance of instakill vs. non-poison resistant foes
- plus any applicable strength and skill bonuses ([Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue"), [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger"), [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist"), [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie"), [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") can all reach expert in dagger)

This gives it a total damage of 29 vs. small and 28 vs. large non-poison resistant foes with a 10% chance of instakill, plus any applicable strength, skill, and blessed damage bonuses.

Compare this with an average of 31.5 / 30.5 for the [Bat from Hell](/wiki/Bat_from_Hell "Bat from Hell") ([club](/wiki/Club "Club") skill), 32.5 / 34.5 for [Reaper](/wiki/Reaper "Reaper") ([polearm](/wiki/Polearm "Polearm") skill), and 34.5 / 34.5 for [Mjollnir](/wiki/Mjollnir "Mjollnir") ([hammer](/wiki/Hammer "Hammer") skill), none of which can instakill, and of which Reaper is two-handed and Mjollnir's damage bonus doesn't apply to to shock-resistant foes. For these reasons, Serpent's Tongue is an excellent end-game choice for either a primary weapon or secondary weapon for #twoweaponing.

## Miscellaneous

Note that this artifact does *not* provide poison-resistance. Also, for [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") characters and [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai"), using it does not incur the usual [alignment penalty](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") for using a poisoned weapon.

Its low base cost makes it one of the few artifacts it is feasible to simply buy (rather than steal) from a shop. Note that you will have to pay 1600zm for it, as the usual 4x artifact surcharge still applies.

## Encyclopedia

No entry.
